entry.title: Clark House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Clark House (pictured) hosted Cold War meetings?

entry.title: Edna Hibel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 2022 book lamented that American painter Edna Hibel did not have a Wikipedia article?

entry.title: swamps in Belarus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there are more than 9,000 swamps in Belarus?

entry.title: Kenichirou Matsuda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before becoming a voice actor, Kenichirou Matsuda attended law school trying to become a civil servant?

entry.title: the first Hindu temple in Wisconsin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first Hindu temple in Wisconsin was built "in the middle of nowhere"?

entry.title: Alan Choe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alan Choe was tasked with developing Queenstown, Singapore's first satellite town, after its British architects left the country in the mid-1950s?

entry.title: Client Hints (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Google's Client Hints proposal was initially classified as "harmful" by Mozilla?

entry.title: Dick Walker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dick Walker's discovery of Saturn's moon Epimetheus was only realized twelve years later?

entry.title: Dazed and Confused (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Richard Linklater's original concept for Dazed and Confused took place entirely within a car as its characters listened to ZZ Top?
